intro: Astragalus platycarpus, commonly known as the broad-fruited milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow or purple flowers. The plant produces small, round seed pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh environments. Astragalus platycarpus plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
